intro: Megalastrum andicola f. lehmannianum, commonly known as the Andean lehmann's mallow, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique adaptations, it plays an important role in the ecological balance of its native habitat.
